description.narrative: El objetivo general es el mejoramiento de la vivienda y el entorno urbano de familias de bajos ingresos viviendo en áreas marginales.

The general objective is to improve the housing and urban conditions for low-income groups living in marginal areas. Basic infrastructure and social services will be provided and the beneficiaries¿ properties will be regularized, integrating these areas socially and urbanistically to the formal city.

activity-description.narrative: Depending on the household, beneficiaries of the home improvement subsidy can receive matching grants up to TT $20,000. The subsidy predominantly targets low to middle income households throughout the country. This particular example is that of a female-headed household in Arima that received a subsidy to complete works on their roof.

Depending on the household, beneficiaries of the home improvement subsidy can receive matching grants up to TT $20,000. The subsidy predominantly targets low to middle income households throughout the country. This particular example is that of a female-headed household in Belmont that received a subsidy to purchase the balance of materials needed and to install the eaves for her house.

Depending on the household, beneficiaries of the home improvement subsidy can receive matching grants up to TT $20,000. The subsidy predominantly targets low to middle income households throughout the country. This particular example is that of a female-headed household in Chase Village that received a subsidy to assist with the cost of works on the roof and the plastering of the walls of their home.

Depending on the household, beneficiaries of the home improvement subsidy can receive matching grants up to TT $20,000. The subsidy predominantly targets low to middle income households throughout the country. This particular example is that of a female-headed household in Claxton Bay that received a subsidy to assist with the purchase and installation of the windows and doors for their house.

Depending on the household, beneficiaries of the home improvement subsidy can receive matching grants up to TT $20,000. The subsidy predominantly targets low to middle income households throughout the country. This particular example is that of a female-headed household in Rio Claro that received a subsidy to assist with the replacement of the flooring and general repair of their home.

Depending on the household, beneficiaries of the home improvement subsidy can receive matching grants up to TT $20,000. The subsidy predominantly targets low to middle income households throughout the country. This particular example is that of a female-headed household in San Fernando that received a subsidy for the purchase and installation of windows and burglar proofing.

Depending on the household, beneficiaries of the home improvement subsidy can receive matching grants up to TT $20,000. The subsidy predominantly targets low to middle income households throughout the country. This particular example is that of a household in Biche that received a subsidy to pay for door and window installation, labour, and the cost to complete the installation of their plumbing fittings and fixtures.

Depending on the household, beneficiaries of the home improvement subsidy can receive matching grants up to TT $20,000. The subsidy predominantly targets low to middle income households throughout the country. This particular example is that of a household in Princes Town that received a subsidy to assist with the overall renovations of their home, beginning with the conversion of their wooden walls into concrete walls.

Depending on the household, beneficiaries of the home improvement subsidy can receive matching grants up to TT $20,000. The subsidy predominantly targets low to middle income households throughout the country. This particular example is that of a household in San Juan that received a subsidy to assist with the repair of their roofing as well as the associated labour cost.

Depending on the household, beneficiaries of the home improvement subsidy can receive matching grants up to TT $20,000. The subsidy predominantly targets low to middle income households throughout the country. This particular example is that of a household located in Barrackpore that received a subsidy to cover the cost plastering material, as well as the purchase and installation of doors and windows.

Depending on the household, beneficiaries of the home improvement subsidy can receive matching grants up to TT $20,000. The subsidy predominantly targets low to middle income households throughout the country. This particular example is that of a household located in Chaguanas that received a subsidy to purchase and install tiling in their home.

Depending on the household, beneficiaries of the home improvement subsidy can receive matching grants up to TT $20,000. The subsidy predominantly targets low to middle income households throughout the country. This particular example is that of a household located in Gasparillo that received a subsidy to erect a steel roof, including the completion of their guttering and gable.

Depending on the household, beneficiaries of the home improvement subsidy can receive matching grants up to TT $20,000. The subsidy predominantly targets low to middle income households throughout the country. This particular example is that of a household located in Penal that received a subsidy to assist in the purchase and installation of kitchen and plumbing facilities.
